location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Public Department, Bombay to Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter is requesting an account current of supplies provided to the East India Company's cruizers employed in an expedition against the Joasmee [QawƒÅsim] pirates in 1809/10, along with receipts or vouchers for arrack supplied to HMS Lionand the British Embassy to Persia in 1811 and 1812 respectively.Enclosed is a copy of a letter from the Marine Board to Sir Evan Nepean, Baronet, President and Governor in Council, Bombay, dated 30 June 1815. The board is having difficulty auditing the accounts of the Marine Agent in the Persian Gulf, and is therefore requesting the information outlined above.
